conbody.p: This topic discusses the prerequisites for installing Midokura.

section.title: Repository Access
section.p: In order to use Midonet with Eucalyptus you will need access to the Midokura repositories. You will receive a username and password.
Create /etc/yum.repos.d/midokura.repo on all machines that will run Midonet components including Zookeeper. For example:
section.codeblock:
[midokura] name=Midokura Repository baseurl=http://USERNAME:PASSWORD@yum.midokura.com/repo/v1.9/stable/RHEL/6/
gpgkey=http://USERNAME:PASSWORD@yum.midokura.com/repo/RPM-GPG-KEY-midokura gpgcheck=1 enabled=1
[midokura-extras] name=Midokura Extras Repository baseurl=http://repo.midonet.org/misc/RHEL/6/misc/ gpgkey=http://USERNAME:PASSWORD@yum.midokura.com/repo/RPM-GPG-KEY-midokura gpgcheck=1 enabled=1

section.title: Zookeeper
section.p: Zookeeper is where Midonet stores most of its running state. This service needs to be up and running before any other installation takes place.
section.note: For advanced zookeeper installation (clustered for reliability), please refer to the Midonet NSDB Installation Guide.
section.p: For a simple single-server installation, install the zookeeper package on any server that is IP accessible from all midolman agents (for example: on the Cloud Controller server itself), start the service and ensure that the service is enabled. For example:
section.codeblock: yum install zookeeper service zookeeper start chkconfig zookeeper on

section.title: Cassandra
section.p: Cassandra is used to track flows in Midonet. This service needs to be up and running before any other installation takes place. For a simple single-server installation, install Cassandra on any server that is IP accessible from all midolman agents (for example: on the Cloud Controller server itself), start the service and ensure that the service is enabled.
To install Cassandra, please refer to the documentation for Cassandra installation and configuration.
section.note: For advanced Midonet-specific installation of Cassandra, please refer to the Midonet NSDB Installation Guide.
